intro: Tournefortiopsis crispiflora subsp. cobanensis, commonly known as the Cobanensis tournefortiopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, hairy leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and ecological adaptations compared to other members of the species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
